The Elder Mahāmoggallāna’s Birth Story
The Fortunate One Anomadassī,
the world’s chief, the bull of a man,
dwelt in the Himalayas,
with a group of gods in front.
I was a nāga king named Varuṇa,
at that time,
I could change my form at will,
and lived in the great ocean.
Having abandoned the group of the assembled,
I played a musical instrument;
having surrounded the Sambuddha,
the celestial nymphs sang songs then.
While the musical instruments were being played,
the gods played musical instruments;
having heard the sound of both,
the Buddha also awoke.
Having invited the Sambuddha,
I went to my own abode;
having prepared a seat,
I announced the time to him.
The leader of the world, surrounded by a thousand of those whose defilements are destroyed,
illuminating all the directions,
came to my abode.🔽The great hero,
the god of gods, the bull of a man,
I satisfied, together with the Community of monks,
with food and drink then.
The great hero approved,
The Self-Existent One, the foremost person,
Sitting in the midst of the Community of monks,
Spoke these verses.
He who worshipped the Community,
And the Buddha, the Leader of the World,
Through that faith in his mind,
Will go to the world of the gods.
For seventy-seven times,
He will rule as king of the gods;
For eight hundred times he will rule as king,
Dwelling on the earth.
For fifty-five times,
He will be a Wheel-turning King;
His wealth will be immeasurable,
As soon as he is reborn.
After an incalculable aeon,
Born in the family of Okkāka,
With the name of Gotama,
He will be a Teacher in the world.
Having passed away from hell,
He will go to the human state;
With the name of Kolita,
He will be a kinsman of Brahmā.
Later, having gone forth,
Urged on by the roots of good,🔽He will be the second disciple
